jwiki.core

Class QueryTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • jwiki.core.QueryTools

  • public class QueryTools
extends Object
    Contains base methods for making queries to the MediaWiki API. Use of this class is intended for anybody wishing to implement their own custom API queries that I have not included in Wiki.java. This is not for the faint of heart, so consider yourself warned :P
    Author:
    Fastily
    See Also:
    Wiki

    • Method Detail

      • doSingleQuery

        public static Reply doSingleQuery(Wiki wiki,
                                  URLBuilder ub)
        Send a single query to the server and read the reply.
        Parameters:
        wiki - The wiki object to use.
        ub - The URLBuilder to use.
        Returns:
        The reply from the server or null if something went wrong.

      • doMultiQuery

        public static ArrayList<Reply> doMultiQuery(Wiki wiki,
                                            URLBuilder ub,
                                            String limString,
                                            String tkey,
                                            ArrayList<String> titles)
        Performs a multi-query on a URL. This method will continue making requests to the server until all the data in the requested set has been returned.
        Parameters:
        wiki - The wiki object to use
        ub - The URLBuilder to use
        limString - The limit string (e.g. ailimit). If this is set in ub, it will be overwritten. This is an optional param. Set to null to disable.
        tkey - The parameter to pass to the server which will be paired with titles. Note that titles in ub *will* be overwritten.
        titles - The list of titles to send to the server. PRECONDITION: These should not be URL-encoded.
        Returns:
        The replies from the server.

      • doNoTitleMultiQuery

        public static ArrayList<Reply> doNoTitleMultiQuery(Wiki wiki,
                                                   URLBuilder ub)
        Performs a multi-query on a URL. This method will continue making requests to the server until all the data in the requested set has been returned. Note that this method does not accept a title param - this method should be used to query software lists (e.g. allpages)
        Parameters:
        wiki - The wiki object to use
        ub - The URLBuilder to use
        Returns:
        The replies from the server.

      • doGroupQuery

        public static ArrayList<Reply> doGroupQuery(Wiki wiki,
                                            URLBuilder ub,
                                            String tkey,
                                            ArrayList<String> titles)
        Performs a group query for multiple titles. This method efficiently passes the maximum number of titles to the server and then saves the results as ServerReplies.
        Parameters:
        wiki - The wiki object to use
        ub - The URLBuilder to use. CAVEAT: anything assigned to the 'titles' param will be overwritten with elements passed into this method's 'titles'. In other words, don't set the ' titles' param when creating ub
        tkey - The parameter name for the list of titles to pass to the server.
        titles - The titles to query.
        Returns:
        The replies from the server.

      • doLimitedQuery

        public static ArrayList<Reply> doLimitedQuery(Wiki wiki,
                                              URLBuilder ub,
                                              String limString,
                                              int cap,
                                              String tkey,
                                              String title)
        Performs a series of queries on a single item but restricts number of returned entries. NB: this method does not actually perform any parsing - it only collects replies. You will have to do the parsing yourself!
        Parameters:
        wiki - The wiki object to use
        ub - The URLBuilder to use
        limString - The limit string (e.g. ailimit). If this is set in ub, it will be overwritten.
        cap - The maximum number of entries to return.
        tkey - The parameter name for the list of titles to pass to the server. Optional param - set to null to disable.
        title - The titles to query. Optional param - used by tkey. Also set this to null if you disabled tkey.
        Returns:
        A list of ServerReplies we collected.

      • applyContinue

        public static boolean applyContinue(URLBuilder ub,
                                    Reply r)
        Identifies the continue JSONObject in a Reply and applies it to a URLBuilder. PRECONDITION: there MUST be a continue obejct in r; this method does not explicitly test for MediaWiki errors or for the presence of a continue object.a
        Parameters:
        ub - The URLBuilder to apply the continue params to
        r - The Reply from the most recent, previous request to the server created by ub.
        Returns:
        True if we encountered no errors.
